author: JosÃ© Luis GÃ³mez Guenchor
title: Acuerdo con Sindicato de Trabajadores NÂ°1 contribuirÃ¡ a sostenibilidad financiera de la UACh
text:
- Lo anterior permite modificar parcialmente el contrato colectivo vigente a partir del 01 de enero del aÃ±o 2024.
Este miÃ©rcoles 27 de diciembre en Casa Central de la Universidad Austral de Chile, el Rector de UACh, Dr. Hans Richter B., firmÃ³ el anexo de contrato colectivo de trabajo junto a la Presidenta del Sindicato Nacional de Trabajadores NÂ°1, Solange Doussoulin e integrantes de la Directiva Sindical: Susana Flores (Secretaria), Marianne Loyola (Tesorera), Bernarda Rivera (Primera Directora) y Christian Sanhueza (Segundo Director). En la oportunidad, tambiÃ©n estuvieron presentes el Vicerrector de GestiÃ³n EconÃ³mica y Administrativa Dr. Pablo HormazÃ¡bal; y el Director JurÃ­dico, Ab. Sergio Valenzuela.
Esto es el resultado de meses de negociaciones y diÃ¡logos con representantes de la directiva sindical, reuniones sostenidas regularmente que fueron encabezadas por el Vicerrector de GestiÃ³n EconÃ³mica y Administrativa con participaciÃ³n del Director de Personal de esta casa de estudios, RaÃºl PilquimÃ¡n y del Director JurÃ­dico. El acuerdo se ratificÃ³ en la votaciÃ³n realizada el 21 de diciembre pasado, ocasiÃ³n en que el 77,5% de socios y socias de la organizaciÃ³n aprobaron la propuesta planteada por la autoridad universitaria, que consiste en modificaciones al contrato colectivo vigente necesarias para contribuir a la operaciÃ³n financiera de la instituciÃ³n.
Tras la firma del anexo la Presidenta del Sindicato NÂ°1 de Trabajadores Solange Doussoulin destacÃ³ que â€œeste fue un esfuerzo que se hizo pensando en el colectivo, donde tenemos un amplio grupo que tiene necesidades, o son mÃ¡s vulnerablesâ€. A su vez expresÃ³ que esta decisiÃ³n se tomÃ³ pensado tambiÃ©n en â€œcuidar nuestra fuente laboralâ€.
Por su parte, el Rector Dr. Hans Richter seÃ±alÃ³ que â€œcon la convicciÃ³n que este consenso al que hemos llegado es un significativo esfuerzo para nuestros trabajadores y sus familias, valoramos este sustantivo apoyo que contribuye en un corto plazo a los equilibrios financieros, que tanto requerimos para nuestra instituciÃ³n en estos momentos. Y esto es producto de un proceso de diÃ¡logo que demorÃ³ varios meses, donde se fueron construyendo consensos en torno a ideas compartidas y finalmente tenemos un documento que da cuenta de un decidido apoyo al futuro de la Universidadâ€.
La autoridad universitaria planteÃ³ que con esto se estÃ¡ contribuyendo directamente al futuro de la Universidad, donde es relevante el apoyo de directivos, cuerpos colegiados y sindicatos. El Sindicato NÂ°1 en particular, dijo, â€œlogrÃ³ una votaciÃ³n muy contundente en torno a dos esquemas para avanzar y al mismo tiempo lo que hemos logrado es proteger a los trabajadores de menores ingresos de la Universidad, lo cual es extremadamente importanteâ€.
Acuerdos del anexo
El contenido del anexo zanja, entre otras cosas, dos de las principales preocupaciones en este proceso de recuperaciÃ³n financiera que enfrenta la UACh: el pago anual del bono extraordinario (o dÃ©cimo tercer sueldo) y reajustes salariales. consiste, entre otros aspectos, en la modificaciÃ³n del contrato colectivo.
SeÃ±ala que se aplicarÃ¡ a los sueldos base en el mes de enero 2024 el 7,1% que corresponde a la diferencia sobre reajustabilidad pendiente de los meses de diciembre 2021 a diciembre 2022. De igual modo, se procede a reajustar los sueldos base, de acuerdo con el IPC acumulado en el aÃ±o 2023 de todos (as) los (las) trabajadores(as) afiliados (as) al Sindicato Nacional NÂ°1 de Trabajadores de la Universidad Austral de Chile.
Sobre el pago del bono extraordinario, para los aÃ±os 2024 y 2025, fija que quienes perciben rentas iguales o inferiores al total base de cÃ¡lculo de $ 1.200.000 lo recibirÃ¡n en el mes de enero 2024. Para quienes perciban rentas sobre este monto, se generarÃ¡ un compromiso de pago a partir de enero de 2026.
El documento firmado incluye otros acuerdos en el marco de los beneficios contenidos en el contrato colectivo original.
Cabe seÃ±alar que el instrumento de anexo de contrato colectivo de trabajo fue depositado el dÃ­a de hoy (27 de diciembre) en la InspecciÃ³n Provincial del Trabajo de Valdivia, ante la Inspectora Provincial del Trabajo, quien recibiÃ³ a los dirigentes del Sindicato y al Director JurÃ­dico, en representaciÃ³n de la Universidad, para formalizar la presentaciÃ³n del documento.

author: Riley Hayes
title: Front Porch Launches Innovative Brain and Balance Center
text: Front Porch Launches Innovative Brain and Balance Center [Riley Hayes](https://investorshangout.com/profile/view?id=79656)Updated: 11-07-2024 05:25 PM Front Porch Introduces a Revolutionary Program In a groundbreaking move, Front Porch, a prominent provider of senior living solutions, is excited to unveil its newly established Brain and Balance Center. This innovative program is set to empower seniors by employing advanced technology to help enhance their balance and cognitive abilities through engaging activities. What Makes the Brain and Balance Center Unique? The Brain and Balance Center distinguishes itself by featuring three cutting-edge technologies: the RAPID Balance Mat System, the S3 Balance device, and SMARTfit. These tools offer a holistic approach that aims to improve not only the physical health of residents but also their mental well-being. As Lisa Dickenson, Director of Fitness and Wellness, states, "Nobody has the three pieces of technology that we have or a Brain and Balance Center. Many places focus solely on balance or cognitive health, but we combine both aspects in one program." State-of-the-Art Technologies for Better Health The RAPID Balance Mat System is instrumental in establishing a baseline for each resident's balance capabilities. It provides personalized exercises tailored to improve their skills progressively. The S3 Balance device, an innovative stand designed for stability, allows residents to confidently engage in balance training. This fosters a sense of safety while enhancing their overall physical strength. Moreover, SMARTfit brings brain training exercises into the mix, reinforcing the understanding that cognitive and physical fitness are deeply interconnected. Measurable Results from Participation Residents who participated in the program for two months reported significant progress, achieving an average balance score improvement of 20%. This remarkable outcome reflects the effectiveness of the program, especially considering that many were already active in maintaining their balance. Lisa emphasized, "For them to show such improvement in such a brief time was truly impressive." This provides clear evidence that the combination of cognitive and physical exercises yields tangible health benefits. Collaboration for Broader Impact The Brain and Balance Center is also joining forces with the Front Porch Center for Innovation and Wellbeing to create a comprehensive program that can extend into other Front Porch communities. This collaboration aims to empower more seniors by promoting healthier and more fulfilling lifestyles across various communities. Learn More About Front Porch As a part of its commitment to enhance senior living, Front Porch offers a variety of innovative solutions tailored to the unique needs of older adults. To explore more about the programs and services offered, community members can visit the official Front Porch website. Frequently Asked Questions What is the Brain and Balance Center? The Brain and Balance Center is a program by Front Porch that helps seniors improve their balance and cognitive function through innovative technologies and activities. What technologies are used in the center? The center utilizes the RAPID Balance Mat System, the S3 Balance device, and SMARTfit to provide a comprehensive approach to health. How effective is the program? Participants have reported an impressive average balance improvement of 20% after just two months of engagement in the program. Who can benefit from the Brain and Balance Center? Seniors looking to enhance both their physical balance and cognitive abilities can participate and benefit significantly from the program. Where can I find more information about Front Porch? More information about Front Porch and its offerings can be found on their official website, which details various communities and services available to seniors. title: Argentine : une nouvelle vague de chaleur et des centaines des milliers de personnes privÃ©es d'Ã©lectricitÃ©
text:
L'Argentine est en train de connaÃ®tre une nouvelle vague de chaleur, frappant 10 des 24 provinces du pays, a dÃ©clarÃ© mercredi le Service mÃ©tÃ©orologique national.
Dans la capitale Buenos Aires, les autoritÃ©s ont Ã©mis une alerte jaune de chaleur, avertissant que les tempÃ©ratures Ã©levÃ©es "pourraient Ãªtre dangereuses, en particulier pour les groupes vulnÃ©rables tels que les enfants, les personnes Ã¢gÃ©es de plus de 65 ans et les personnes souffrant de maladies chroniques".
L'indice de chaleur a atteint 44,4 degrÃ©s Celsius peu aprÃ¨s 14H45 heure locale.
Des milliers d'habitants de Buenos Aires se sont rÃ©fugiÃ©s dans des centres commerciaux climatisÃ©s, des parcs et des sites de loisirs comme le parc de los Ninos dans le nord et celui de la Ciudad dans le sud.
Des pannes d'Ã©lectricitÃ© se sont produites dans la rÃ©gion mÃ©tropolitaine de Buenos Aires, affectant plus de 622.000 utilisateurs, environ 2 millions de personnes, ont rapportÃ© les mÃ©dias locaux.
Les Ã©difices gouvernementaux, y compris le Palais prÃ©sidentiel et le MinistÃ¨re d'Ã©conomie, ont Ã©tÃ© privÃ©s d'Ã©lectricitÃ©. Plusieurs lignes de train en banlieue et de mÃ©tro ont Ã©tÃ© suspendues ou limitÃ©es.
Les quartiers du centre, du sud et de l'ouest de la capitale ont souffert de pannes d'Ã©lectricitÃ©, entraÃ®nant des perturbations gÃ©nÃ©ralisÃ©es de la circulation en raison du non-fonctionnement des feux de circulation, le premier jour ouvrable aprÃ¨s les vacances du carnaval.
Le Service mÃ©tÃ©orologique national a Ã©mis une alerte rouge (le plus haut niveau) pour certaines rÃ©gions des provinces de Corrientes, Formosa, Chaco, Misiones et Santiago del Estero, indiquant que les tempÃ©ratures Ã©levÃ©es sont "extrÃªmement dangereuses et peuvent affecter tous les individus, mÃªme ceux qui sont en bonne santÃ©".

author: Alex Cuenca
title: Huelga ilimitada en Easyjet Francia por el cierre de una base
text:
Tremenda decisiÃ³n sindical: Easyjet habÃ­a anunciado, tras trece aÃ±os, el cierre de su base en el aeropuerto de Toulouse, Francia, donde tiene sÃ³lo dos aviones. Los empleados, no sÃ³lo de Toulouse, sino de toda Francia han convocado una huelga indefinida en protesta.
En marzo de 2025, la direcciÃ³n de la low-cost britÃ¡nica iba a cerrar su base en Toulouse. Pero ayer mismo la UNAC, el sindicato de la aviaciÃ³n, presentÃ³ un aviso de huelga indefinida en protesta por la decisiÃ³n.
El paro comenzarÃ¡ este lunes, fecha en la que, ademÃ¡s, se deben iniciar las negociaciones de un nuevo convenio.
Los sindicatos han criticado que los resultados de la low cost en su base de Toulouse fueron excelentes. Lâ€™Echo Touristique, una publicaciÃ³n francesa especializada, informa que la empresa ha pedido tranquilidad.
Easyjet emplea a 125 trabajadores en la base francesa, desde donde cubre 20 destinos. Los mismos probablemente seguirÃ¡n siendo atendidos, pero desde otras bases. La aerolÃ­nea dijo que a estos trabajadores no se les despide sino que podrÃ¡n optar por cualquiera de las otras bases en Francia. Easyjet opera en otras seis ciudades, Niza, ParÃ­s (dos aeropuertos), Burdeos, Nantes y Lyon.

author: financialcontent.com
title: Winfinity Unveils New Competitions Website in the UK | FinancialContent Business Page
text:
12/28/2023, London
Winfinity is a new competitions website in the UK offering bi-weekly prize draws and spectacular prizes. The prizes include the latest smartphones, luxurious watches, cash prizes, premier cars, and many more. At least one draw occurs bi-weekly so members do not run out of opportunities to win exciting prizes. The platform works using fixed-odd competitions, which is an excellent way for players to get a chance to win a bike, car, van, motorhome, watch, camper, or any other luxury item. The prizes are drawn live every other Thursday at 4 PM on Facebook. All the prizes come with a guaranteed draw date and winner, irrespective of the sold-out tickets.
Winfinity Competitions This means that even if not all the tickets are sold, the draw will still occur at the set time and date. The platform does not extend the draw dates whatsoever. Every Monday, Winfinity also gives away free prizes worth Â£500. Anyone can enter this Monday Draw by buying a ticket for the normal competition prizes. There is, however, a set amount of tickets per prize with a guaranteed winner. Winning a prize at Winfinity Comps is as simple as visiting the website, selecting the competition, choosing a prize from the selection, logging in or registering and adding tickets to the basket, proceeding to checkout using debit or credit cards, and just waiting for the draw.
The website is currently running a Â£500 Amazon voucher , Â£500 Smyths Toy Store voucher, and Nintendo Switch OLED, all at Â£1.99 per ticket. The selection process of winners is totally unbiased and transparent. The company uses a 100% random ball-spinning machine for completely random results. All the draws are conducted on Facebook Live for utmost transparency. In the absence of a ball machine, the platform uses an online Google Random Number Generator that is also live.
Winfinity Competitions tries to contact the winners and ensures the prizes are given to them. The entire process is pretty straightforward. Once an individual registers on the portal, they can choose any competition, buy a ticket, play the challenge, and win a prize. Winfinity Comps are closed when all the tickets are sold out or on the draw date, whichever comes first. Although members can enter a competition multiple times, they should stay within specified limits. The best thing about these competitions is that winners get to keep the prize, gift it, or sell it. The aim here is to make prize collection as easy and convenient as possible.
To learn more, visit https://www.winfinitycompetitions.com/competitions/ .
About Winfinity Competitions
Winfinity Competitions is a platform that provides incredible opportunities for consumers to win prizes in various categories. From smartphones to cars, watches to cash prizes, this place ensures that customers always have options for winning bonanzas. There is something for everyone who visits this site.
###
Contact
Winfinity
Website: https://www.winfinitycompetitions.com/
Email: Info@winfinitycompetitions.com

author: Daily Excelsior
title: Retired Police Officer Shot Dead By Terrorists While Giving Call For 'Azaan'
text: SRINAGAR, Dec 24: A 72-year-old retired police officer, who was the local â€œmuezzinâ€, was shot dead by terrorists while he was giving the call for â€œazaanâ€ from a mosque in Jammu and Kashmirâ€™s Baramulla district on Sunday, police said. Recalling the moments before Mohammad Shafi Mir was killed, his cousin Mohammad Mustafa, who was at home, said the call for the pre-dawn prayers was being given by a loudspeaker and suddenly it stopped. His last words were â€œreham (mercy)â€, he said. The â€œazaanâ€ had stopped at â€œAshhadu Anna Mohammadu Rasool-Allah (I bear witness that Mohammad is the messenger of Allah)â€, he said. Police said Mir retired as a senior superintendent of police in 2012. He was shot dead by terrorists inside the mosque in the Gantmulla locality of the north Kashmir districtâ€™s Sheeri area early Sunday, they said. â€œTerrorists fired upon Shri Mohd Shafi, a retired police officer, at Gantmulla, Sheeri Baramulla, while praying â€˜azaanâ€™ in the mosque and succumbed to injuries,â€ the Kashmir Zone Police said in a post on X. Mir had become the local â€œmuezzinâ€ â€” a person who calls for prayers â€” and he was devoted to his duties at the mosque, his family members said. Following the incident, a large number of people gathered at Mirâ€™s house and at the mosque complex. Mir is survived by his wife, two sons and a daughter. Talking to reporters, Mustafa said, â€œHe (Mir) was my cousin. He used to call for prayers every day. This morning, while I was reading the Quran, as usual, he started the â€˜azaanâ€™, so I closed the Quran.â€ â€œHe recited â€˜Ashhadu Anna Mohammadu Rasool-Allahâ€™ and then the â€˜azaanâ€™ stopped. I only heard a shout of â€˜rehamâ€™ (mercy). It was in a heavy voice,â€ he said. Mustafa said he thought Mir might have stopped his call due to some other reason and guessed he could have collapsed due to dizziness. But it was after some time that people came to know about the incident, he said. â€œMy daughter came and told me that Shafi uncle is died. We went to his house and learnt that Mir had been taken to Baramulla (hospital)â€¦We were told he had suffered bullet injuries,â€ he said. Some of Mirâ€™s relatives claimed he was shot four times. Mirâ€™s younger brother Abdul Kareem said he was sleeping, but was woken up by sounds which he assumed could have been caused because of a problem in the microphone. â€œMy daughter-in-law said she heard people cryingâ€¦,â€ he said. â€œMir used to give the call for â€˜azaanâ€™ every day. I think this was planned as the Imam Sahib (prayer leader) goes home on Saturday and returns on Sunday,â€ Kareem said. Political parties condemned the killing and expressed their condolences to the former police officerâ€™s family. The National Conference (NC) said violence can never be tolerated in any form. â€œJKNC president Dr Farooq Abdullah and VP @OmarAbdullah express profound sadness over the tragic Baramulla incident, where retired SP Mohammad Shafi was senselessly shot dead,â€ the party said in a post on X. Peoplesâ€™ Democratic Party (PDP) president Mehbooba Mufti said innocent people have become â€œcollateral damage to maintain the facade of normalcy toutedâ€ by the Centre. â€œFive jawans martyred in a militant ambush, three innocent civilians tortured to death in custody by army, many still battling for their lives in hospitals and now a retired SP killed. Innocent people have become collateral damage to maintain the facade of normalcy touted by GoI,â€ Mufti posted on X. The BJP termed the act dastardly and said terror and terrorists have no religion. â€œDastardly act of killing of 72-year-old retired police officer by those who have no religion. The sons of devil canâ€™t even tolerate â€˜azaanâ€™â€¦ Terror and terrorists have no religion. Strongly condemn this killing, express my solidarity with the bereaved family,â€ BJPâ€™s Jammu and Kashmir spokesman Altaf Thakur said. Jammu and Kashmir Apni Party chief Altaf Bukhari in a post on X said, â€œCondemn the cowardly killing of retired SSP Mr. Mohammad Shafi Mir in Gantmulla, Baramulla. My heartfelt condolences to the bereaved family in this hour of utter grief and demise. May the departed soul rest in peace and solace in the world hereafter.â€ He said the cowardly act goes on to show the true colours of the killers as the slain was shot upon while giving a call for prayer. Peoples Conference president Sajad Lone also condemned the killing. â€œYet another sad news. My prayers and thoughts are with the family of Mohd Shafi Sahib. May Allah grant him Jannat. And hope that J-K Police recognises the challenges facing it. Evaluating security threat is a science and canâ€™t be left to likes and dislikes, and whims,â€ Lone said in a post on X. (AGENCIES) Retired Police Officer Shot Dead By Terrorists While Giving Call For â€˜Azaanâ€™ SRINAGAR, Dec 24: A 72-year-old retired police officer, who was the local â€œmuezzinâ€, was shot dead by terrorists while he was giving the call for â€œazaanâ€ from a mosque in Jammu and Kashmirâ€™s Baramulla district on Sunday, police said.

author: James Salazar | Examiner staff writer
title: SF weather forecasts first spring 2024 rain in The City | Climate | sfexaminer.com
text: A cold front approaching San Francisco from the northwest will bring rain and cold temperatures to The City, with the dreary conditions expected to last most of this weekend. The inclement springtime weather is expected to return midway through next week following a brief respite. Dylan Flynn, a meteorologist with the National Weather Service Bay Area , told The Examiner that the month of March represents one of San Franciscoâ€™s last big chances at rainfall before the end of the water year on Sept. 30. The month of April will mark a transition to much drier conditions in May, he said. â€œWeâ€™re still kind of in the tail end of the rainy season here so this is not out of the ordinary,â€ Flynn said. Through Thursday night, San Francisco had recorded nearly 22 inches of rainfall during the water year beginning Oct. 1, according to the agency. That amounted to 113% of the March 21 normal, and nearly 96% of normal for the full water year. This weekendâ€™s storms wonâ€™t be a deluge by any means, according to NWS projections. San Francisco is expected to get anywhere from a half-inch to an inch of rain. Ex // Top Stories Now in his 70s, the legendary author, inventor and futurist revisits his prediction of the melding of human and machine, with 20 additional years of data in tow An executive directive issued by Mayor London Breed would create a screening process to identify vulnerable concrete buildings and update The City's existing building code. City Attorney David Chiu accused the East Bay city of trying to increase its airportâ€™s passenger traffic and profits with the move â€œWe donâ€™t expect major flooding concerns or anything like that,â€ Flynn said. â€œJust kind of a dreary day with cooler weather and some wind and periods of rain.â€ San Franciscans will see rain for several hours beginning Friday night, as well as some winds blowing out of the south . Flynn said Saturdayâ€™s weather conditions will be different, as the cold front will have already passed over The City. â€œWeâ€™ll switch to more showers, but theyâ€™re gonna be spotty,â€ Flynn said. Some of these showers, he added, could develop into stronger precipitation. There is also a slight chance of thunderstorms. Flynn said NWS meteorologists expect another cold front to return to The City next Wednesday, bringing similar conditions. â€œThat looks like itâ€™s gonna be a little less impactful,â€ Flynn said. â€œItâ€™s another cold front that comes through and brings mostly beneficial rain to the area.â€

author: Our Correspondent
title: England beat Pakistan in PD Champions Trophy
text:
KARACHI: Pakistan PD was defeated by England PD by 62 runs in the PD Champions Trophy held in Sri Lankaâ€™s capital Colombo. England PD captain Callum Flynn won the toss and elected to bat first at the BOI Cricket Ground.
The entire team of England PD was all out by scoring 144 runs in the allotted 20 overs. Hugo Hammond scored 43 off 29 balls with 4 fours and 2 sixes, Liam Obrien scored 25 off 28 balls with 2 fours and 1 six, while captain Callum Flynn scored 21 runs off just 15 balls with 4 fours.
Waqif Shah took 2 wickets for 19 runs, while Abdul Basit and captain Abdullah Ijaz also took 2, 2 wickets for 25 runs. Chasing 145 runs, Pakistanâ€™s PD batsmen kept losing wickets from the start. Ghulam Muhammad and Waqif Shah scored 17 and 17 runs respectively.
Jordan Williams bowled well for England PD, taking 3 wickets for just 10 runs, while Anthony Clapham took 2 wickets for 24 runs. Englandâ€™s Jordan Williams was given the man of the match award.
